sentences.tran: 做这份工作有时要到国外出差。

sentences.tran: 该学位课程有两个主要目标。

sentences.tran: 主要目的是要增长儿童的地理知识。

sentences.tran: 定下了明确的目标并坚持到底。

sentences.content: One of your first business objectives should be to get your own office.
sentences.tran: 你的首要工作目标之一应该是拥有自己的办公室。

trans.tran_other: to give a plan, piece of writing etc to someone in authority for them to consider or approve

sentences.tran: 他们昨天向财政大臣提交了他们的报告。

trans.tran_other: to recognize and correctly name someone or something

sentences.tran: 警方采集了指纹，对尸体作了身份确认。

trans.tran_other: to give someone a disease

trans.tran_other: the act or ceremony of putting a dead body into a  grave

sentences.content: a work of pure genius

sentences.tran: 韦斯特维尔的居民

sentences.tran: 欧洲的农场主们正在策划一场反对削减农场补贴的大游行。

sentences.tran: 在传统的烤炉中烘烤20分钟，在微波炉里则烤8分钟。

trans.tran_other: to take something or someone illegally from one country to another

trans.tran_other: A lobbyist is someone who tries actively to persuade a government or council that a particular law should be changed or that a particular thing should be done

sentences.content: Lobbyists for the tobacco industry have expressed concerns about the restriction of smoking in public places.
sentences.tran: 烟草业的游说者们对在公共场所限制吸烟表示关切。

trans.tran_other: to become smaller in size, importance, or value, or make something do this

sentences.content: Gradually her anxiety lessened.
sentences.tran: 她的焦虑慢慢减轻了。

trans.tran_other: a small gun that you hold in one hand when you fire it

sentences.content: They were yesterday convicted of illegally using a handgun.
sentences.tran: 他们昨天被判犯有非法使用手枪罪。

sentences.content: They began to tussle with each other for the handgun.
sentences.tran: 他们互相扭打起来,抢夺那支手枪。

trans.tran_other: having a lot of influence and therefore changing the way people think and behave

sentences.content: He had influential friends.
sentences.tran: 他有一些有影响力的朋友。

sentences.content: a highly influential art magazine
sentences.tran: 一本极有影响力的艺术杂志

trans.tran_other: not reacting to or becoming involved in something in an emotional way

sentences.content: Try to take a more detached view .
sentences.tran: 尽量采取更为客观的态度。

trans.tran_other: a book that tells what has happened in someone’s life, written by someone else

sentences.content: ...recent biographies of Stalin.
sentences.tran: …近年的斯大林传记。

trans.tran_other: the subjects that are taught by a school, college etc, or the things that are studied in a particular subject

sentences.content: Languages are an essential part of the school curriculum.
sentences.tran: 语言是学校课程中必不可少的部分。

sentences.content: curriculum planning
sentences.tran: 课程安排

trans.tran_other: the difference between what it costs a business to buy or produce something and what they sell it for

sentences.content: Margins are low and many companies are struggling.
sentences.tran: 利润很少，很多公司都在苦苦挣扎。

sentences.content: Within 10 years they had a gross profit margin of 50%.
sentences.tran: 10年里他们的毛利率达到了50%。

trans.tran_other: With a lack of fear.

sentences.content: He gazed fearlessly at the gunman.
sentences.tran: 他毫不畏惧地注视着那枪手。

trans.tran_other: Without method or conscious decision; indiscriminately.

sentences.content: The winning numbers are randomly selected by computer.
sentences.tran: 中奖号码是由电脑随机选取的。

sentences.content: My phone seems to switch itself off randomly.
sentences.tran: 我的手机好像随时自动关机。

trans.tran_other: the practice of treating one person or group differently from another in an unfair way

sentences.content: laws to prevent discrimination
sentences.tran: 防止歧视的法律

trans.tran_other: something that helps a process to develop more quickly or more strongly

sentences.content: Tax cuts provided the stimulus which the slow economy needed.
sentences.tran: 减税为不景气的经济带来了其所需的刺激。

trans.tran_other: the ability to do something well

sentences.content: Typing is considered by most employers to be a basic competence.
sentences.tran: 大多数雇主认为打字是一项基本技能。

trans.tran_other: to go somewhere secretly and quietly in order to avoid being seen or heard

sentences.content: Sometimes he would sneak out of his house late at night to be with me.
sentences.tran: 有时候他会在深夜偷偷溜出他的家来陪伴我。

trans.tran_other: to be more than a particular number or amount

sentences.content: Working hours must not exceed 42 hours a week.
sentences.tran: 工作时间每周不得超过42小时。

sentences.content: His performance exceeded our expectations.
sentences.tran: 他的表现出乎我们的预料。

trans.tran_other: irregular and violent movements of air or water that are caused by the wind

sentences.content: The plane encountered severe turbulence and winds of nearly two-hundred miles an hour.
sentences.tran: 那架飞机遇到了强湍流和时速近二百英里的强风。

sentences.content: A period of political turbulence followed the civil war
sentences.tran: 内战结束之后紧接着的是一段政治动荡时期。

trans.tran_other: if you address a problem, you start trying to solve it

sentences.content: Our products address the needs of real users.
sentences.tran: 我们的产品满足真正用户的需要。
